intro: Hippocrepis comosa, commonly known as the woolly betony, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and showy, violet-blue flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Hippocrepis comosa is often found in open, disturbed areas and is considered a characteristic species of Mediterranean vegetation.
